body:
### Describe the bug

cdef classes defined in ``some_module/__init__.pyx`` and compiled into ``some_module/__init__.pyd`` have their ``__module__`` attribute equal to ``"some_module.__init__"`` instead of ``"some_module"``. (In contrast, native classes and functions defined in the same file have the correct ``__module__`` attribute.)

### Code to reproduce the behaviour:

``some_module/__init__.pyx``:

```cython
# cython: language_level=3

cdef class CDefClass:
    pass

class NativeClass:
    pass
```

``setup.py``:

```
from setuptools import Extension, setup

setup(
    ext_modules=[
        Extension(name="some_module.__init__", sources=["some_module/__init__.pyx"])
    ]
)
```

(Note the use of ``name="some_module.__init__`` instead of ``name="some_module"`` as setuptools otherwise does not know to to install ``__init__.pyx`` as ``some_module/__init__.pyd``. The bug only occurs in this scenario where ``__init__.pyd`` is targetted.)

Test:

```
>>> import some_module
>>> some_module.NativeClass.__module__
'some_module'
>>> some_module.CDefClass.__module__   
'some_module.__init__'
```

A minimal example can also be found here:

https://github.com/mcmtroffaes/test_cython_module_attr

### Expected behaviour

```
>>> some_module.CDefClass.__module__   
'some_module'
```

### OS

Windows 11

### Python version

3.12.1

### Cython version

3.0.11

### Additional context

Setuptools version 75.0.0
title: [BUG] invalid __module__ attribute in cdef classes defined in __init__.pyd files
